content: The new version works pretty well

takes at least a 3-4 disconnects of USC cable to function properly

Hasn't been updated in more than one year. Malfunctions with my Kensington trackball. Switching only works through keyboard shortcut. Should work wirelessly (tested with ADB wifi), but still requires phone to be connected through cable. Unable to find Pro installer in Google Play, only Free.
great application , i only have 1 issue when i disconnect the cable , i can't use the phone keyboard , i have to force stop the application so that the android keyboard comes back
My workflow is in hyperdrive! Finally got this going this morning w/ synergy. Awesome!
Unfortunately stopped working for me and developer is not responding to emails and I'm denied requests for a refund.

All the mouse based features are fine. But the problem comes when I use the keyboard. If I press backspace on my keyboard, it removes the entire line instead of just one character. This makes me have to bring up Google keyboard every time I want to use backspace. Please issue a fix for this.
Works well in LG V50. Pretty cool app. I can use my wireless mouse and keyboard in my PC and android phone at the same time.
Really nice app, good for productivity!

Awesome app! The developer helped me to workaround the cursor issue because it kept going down every time I drag up. However, the cursor still needs some fixing in horizontal mode because it clicks a bit to the left and not right at the tip. Thank you for this app anyway, I can live with that!
Best remote control app. Interacting with "Synergy" app is god-tier dev work, thank you for making this.
it is a little confusing to get to work properlt, but once it is going it works the way it is suppose to.

love It, looking forward to improvements to where I can carry the mouse functions over. I have a Logitech MX Master 3, it would be nice to be able to use it's functions on my tablet. But I love this application!

Awesome, this app is really helpful and exactly what I wanted. I followed the instructions and was able to get it working, specially with no root involved. It would be even more awesome that somehow the mouse and keyboard devices were also detected when using a second screen (desktop mode) on your android device, since the focus stays on your phone screen and not passed down to the second screen on your android devices, but I guess that is too much to ask.

where has this been all my life? this app was cool already but the latest version allows your device to interface with Synergy/Barrier which I've been looking for forever. The only drawback is it only works with a USB connection - it would be perfect if it worked over the network, but I'm sure the dev would have included that if it were possible. Definitely worth the buy.
Bought to test. Doesn't work in Samsung Dex mode. Works great but the app won't run in Samsung Dex mode.

Works beautifully! Looked at several solutions to extend the monitor to tablet from mac, but most of them are riddled with bugs and crappy behaviour. This is absolutely the perfect solution I was looking for! Kudos!
galaxy tab s6 is not detected. What should I do?

Fantastic use for an old tablet. Setup some clips on my laptop and attached tablet running the app and it works with keyboard and mouse great. Easy access to things that are harder to work with on PC.

You need an adb connection for this, but if you have one, it works marvelously! It kinda feels like what I was hoping Synergy was going to be on Android, and now I can use both my computer and tablet with my keyboard and mouse--it makes it feel like another monitor~ You can also move things between tablets and desktops super-easily, and that little bonus makes it super-easy to basically offload anything that my tablet can handle that would usually be too annoying because of the need to switch devices and mental contexts. Oh, and if you're into those things, it also makes Tasker and Termux *significantly* easier to use!
I really struggeled setting this app up but after some googling and driver installations this app is AWESOME! Makes my home office experience so much more dynamic!
Need refund Cannot connect to windows Purchased pro version and it only worked once then just does not connect Same port and same USB same device Cannot destroy my phone now been plug-in in and out

Truly amazing and helpful, kudos to the devs for making such a helpful app, my android tablet now feels like an extension of my pc and integrates very well into my workflow. The usb based connection is just the cherry on top of the cake, the connection remains rock solid and most importantly reliable. There is a very very minor input lag and the desktop client ocassionally needs a restart to restore functionality (thats just me nitpicking). I hope the devs keep maintaing this awesome app.
Great app. Helps me a lot every day. However I don't like that my pointer speed is reduced when using the app.
Straightforward and does exactly what's on the tin!

I'm an Android developer and this application is helping me a lot in my projects. I leave my phone on a flexible holder and just slide the mouse over its screen to test my app and it saves me a lot of time. Unfortunately it sometimes takes a while to connect, when I use a hotkey to switch between phone and computer the keyboard doesn't work properly. When I disconnect from the DeskDock the phone virtual keyboard is not set as the default. In any case. The app is great and as a developer I understand that everything can be improved one day.
Amazing, one of the most usefull apps I ever installed on my device. Also if you are interested in the devoloping side, is definitely a must have.

The mouse buttons might be confusing for ametures, so I would suggest to make a visual representation for every buttons if possible. It would make interface much more intuitive. 5 stars for the synergy benefit.
This app works 1% of the time, even when everything is set up correctly. I've sent emails to the developer and have not received any response. The app never gets any updates. Stay away from this app.
Please fix. I pay for this app. Sometime its lag. I need to restart my computer. Lost everything. Bad service
Had an issue with it and the developer addressed my complaint. Works great now. Nice work!

It works great. Turn on ‘USB debugging’ via ‘Developer options’ when asked for permission to connect to this pc select ‘always trust this pc (or something like that)‘. Put your phone on USB for file transfer. Run the app on your phone. Now run the Deskdock server on windows, connect the phone to pc via usb, wait a few seconds, and press ‘connect’ on the app on your phone. It should now be connected. Drag your mouse along edges of your display and it wil jump over to your phone. Server settings
Totally worth the price. Like this thing. Speed is good. Makes life easier.

Wow! I type this review with my keyborad PC's! Btw, I put on three stars because its stopped working when my phone goes to landscape. Is this a bug or I did missed something on the instrauction or something like i did not use the correct ADB drivers?
Awesome!!!! It need can to connect wifi to be the better app, but i liked it ;)
Can be flakey but when it works - its great.

I use alt+tab and then without realising, the alt tab stuck and messed up my backspace and enter key, you just need to press alt when in android. thanks for this app, hope you can do a wireless connection in the future. Worth the money

I have updated my review from 5 stars to 3 stars, simply because the app is very inconsistent and buggy. It works fine sometimes and others time it required considerable effort to work properly. I have had to uninstall and reinstall the app on both my pc and tablet and repeatedly unplug the cable testing attempting to get both app to regocnize each other. It is a great app when it works, but that variable level of performance is mostly headache inducing.

Works great! But i did not purchase because I think it need more features. A. Use the phone as an additional display option instead of just hovering the most over it or using the keyboard. B. Drag and dropping links only work from mac to phone. C. installation files should be readily available on yiur website. I had to sign up to another one to DL. D. Its hard to fully use the phone using mouse/KB alone. No gesture support.
Bought the Pro Version thinking it would work with Samsung Dex desktop but it doesn't. Only works in phone mirror mode. :-(

its a wondeful concept but sadly it doesnt work flawlessly. right now i cant switch displays with my mouse although it worked earlier. when i use the shortcut or move my mouse to the border, the pointer jumps to the middle of the primary screen instead of switching screend. thats annoying. does someone have a solution for this?
Great app, works really good. For some reason sometimes the connection is lost but usually it's because I restarted the computer or stuff like that.
Its very Inconsistent, sometimes it dont work at all. Adding a wireless support via LAN Router would be worth 5 star.
Not working.... Don't know why.... I done exactly as described or informed by aap developer. Wasted my money on such a wasted aap...
Pretty sweet custom software, feel like a real hacker now lol
Help, please. Cursor does travel between PC and Android phone, but the click function does not work

Works as described. Allows you to set up phone as a secondary display. Very cool. I really appreciate the feature that allows you to move the mouse between phone and desktop with a shortcut key. I find this useful because it get buggy when using anything but 100% display scaling. Great work.
lot of bugs, seriously. Connection issues. Mouse flikering issues

I've been using this as my daily driver for my android development across Tablet and phone. A great productivity tool during testing. When it's connected, it works flawlessly. I also use ShareMouse to move between my PC and Mac, and DeskDock works really well with it. I can now seamlessly move between Mac, PC and Android! My only gripe is when you first try to connect. As another reviewer so poetically put - "If it stops working, close the program, try again, close the app, try again, rinse, repeat." After this little dance (sometimes several times!), everything works great, even if I disconnect my phone and plug it back in when back in the office. If this happens to you, the one process I found that seems to work most of the time: - Exit the server app on your desktop. - On the Android app, first 'Disconnect' then exit and close the app completely. - Start the desktop server again. - Open the Android app. - Hit Connect. Apart from this little annoyance, the app is superb.

Great app, the only reason I gave it four stars is occasionally when I'm using it for longer periods of time my wallpaper and lock screen background will change to random images, which is very annoying but ultimately not a big deal
laptop getting hung frequently. Please fix the issue. otherwise Pro version is best.
I've been waiting for an app like this for so long! The fact it can bridge a Synergy server and that the server also runs on Linux is amazing!
Works Great again after going dodgy for a while, maybe my setup
It will be better if I type from my physical keyboard, the virtual android keyboard are disappeared programmatically

Very nice app, it allows using the mouse and keyboard on my tablet which sits on the side of my laptop. Now I don't have to switch between bluetooth connections with my mouse just to do things on the tablet.

Overall this app is great. Does everything it claims to do. I have the pro version and it's worth the money. Only gripe is that occasionally the copy/paste function stops working randomly and I have to restart my phone to get it back. Besides that, it's perfect.
Very inconsistent. Sometimes it works like a charm, other times you cannot successfully connect your PC to the app.
Please, how can I get it to work? Paid for PRo, feel cheated...
Still using this app. It works well
Does EXACTLY as it says. If it stops working, close the program, try again, close the app, try again, rinse, repeat. Works like a charm once its running.
The keyboard feature (the only thing anybody wants) worked ONE time and never again. Rebooted the pc and phone 5 times never worked again. Dont purchase the pro version it doesn't work.
replyContent: The keyboard is working fine for most users. If it isn't for you, send me an email and I'll figure out what's the problem.

content: Hi I am receiving a lot of ads on my phone, when using this app. I have paid for it, still i am receiving such ads. Please remove ads from your app.
come in handy when your screen broke!!

This is a great app. Works great when it's working. Still need to try to connect and run the server in a particular order for it to work. The developer did a great job! Well done. Hopefully one day there will be a feature to connect to the mobile device wirelessly.

EDIT: I have contacted the developer who was responsive to respond to the outlined issues. I wasn't able to get them resolved on my end (completely my decision and not the dev), and ended up moving to using the application scrcpy, which is different but accomplishes the functionality I want. Fantastic little utility for being able to control your 'droid from a keyboard or mouse or even trackpad! As with most power-user tools, this delivers on some features and is missing out on others. I'm mainly just happy to have keyboard/mouse control on my phone. Some things I needed to do to get it setup and working: 1. Android Debugging USB mode set to ON 2. Install Java JRE 7 or above 3. No need to install Android drivers on mac! But you might need to do that here. 4. Ensure Accessibility options are turned ON for DeskDock on your phone (otherwise you won't be able to interact w/phone via mouse or keyboard though you may be able to connect) 4. Run DeskDock on your phone 5. Run DeskDock on your computer 6. if no connection, kill the DeskDock on your computer and start it again -> fixed my initial setup issue where the server would not connect WISHLIST: Setup number 6. would probably not be necessary if the developer is able to fix this issue. Keyboard shortcut in DeskDock server broken for me it seems. "native" keyboard/mouse integration. "pointer speed" in seems not to work with this and my droid doesn't recognize physical keyboard as connected.
replyContent: Please send me bugs or feature request via email.

content: 1.2.1 Woirks great! Thank you so much for the best app ever! Todd

I tried DeskDock as SideSync is dying, and most of what I used it for was to use my keyboard and mouse on my tablet. It works very well most of the time and does exactly what I expected it to do. Only rarely does it goof up and the keyboard not work right, or the PC side of the app crash. I'd say up time is easily over 95% even if used all day like I often do. automatically connects when plugged in as well, just needs to be that little bit more stable for a 5 star.

I have been using DeskDock Pro daily for years and it is my favorite application by far. This allows me to stay focused with one keyboard and mouse and connect my phone to my 4 monitor array to make me much more efficient. That and I have contacted the developer twice over the time I have had the application and a response was fast and very helpful each time. Keep up the great work, thank you for such a helpful application and filling this void! Todd

The idea is amazing, and when it works, it works perfectly. BUT I've used it with some devices already (OnePlus 6T, Sony Xperia XZ, Samsung S7) and sometimes it takes a few tries before it actually connects. Some days I need to restart my device. But it's wonderful to work without grabbing my cellphone constantly, and I hate typing on the touchscreen :)
Pretty annoying on Android 9. About as finicky as they come.
replyContent: What exactly isn't working for you? Please send me an email.

content: Tricky to set up, beautiful to use.

I have been using this app for years. When I get a new phone it is one of the first Apps I install. Many people I work with when they see it also install. It is a great help when developing Android applications, also super for interacting with phone at work without looking like your not focused on the job. I can write instant messages on my phone and it looks like I am answering an email or making a document on my PC.   If I could recommend one feature or improvement it would be to include an option to force screen rotation to match expectation of server.  I currently use a work around solution that forces screen rotation when plugged in, but if it was built into the app it would be better.   Without the work around when phone is landscape but I am on home screen phone is impossible to control with mouse.

I'm excited. I have mouse and keyboard on my tablet! I read several reviews that seemed like it wouldn't work. Maybe when I put more miles I'll have a problem, but it worked right away, and it works just like I would want! I'm on Linux (debian) and Nougat on a Nexus 10. I love this. I'm typing this on my computer keyboard rn. I use synergy every day between Linux and macOS. I just copied from my tablet and pasted onto Linux then continued over to my mac and boom, pasted, it works with synergy.
Great app I already bought the PRO version but my computer keeps freezing all the time im using windows 10.
works until it doesn't. samsung s10 update just broke it again. not the developers fault, but support needed. EDIT: Eventually got it working again. Typing with my key board now. Added a star.

This is a really solid App, does what you want it too exactly when you want it to, only concern is that the desktop server app doesn't automatically start on PC launch, although this is easy to do manually if you drop an app shortcut into the startup folder. - Another point for some reason the mouse cursor on my phone screen isn't correctly centred, instead of adding a touch input at the cursor location it touched about 300 pixels to the left. Using XZ premium.
Totally worth buying. Though be sure to try the lite version first to make sure it works on your phone.
Used to work. But is not working on my windows 10 4k display with my android oneplus7 running pie. cant enter the cursor in to the android display anymore. will give 5 when it works again
replyContent: Please send me an email with details.

content: Emailed dev 6 days ago, no response. I can't get this to work at all on my Pixel 3. I did everything that the setup page says to do but still no luck. I will change my rating if I can get it set up and working.
replyContent: I might not respond immediately, but I do respond to every reasonably polite email. Pixel 3 should work if correctly set up.

content: doesn't work correctly with s5e
replyContent: It most likely does, if set up correctly. Email me if you need assistance.

content: This app is wonderful. I keep my old phone (NEXUS 5) as a companion device for my PC and it is very convenient to be able to control both PC and the phone, sharing the mouse and the keyboard. In fact, I'm writing this review using the same keyboard. Only problem I'm experiencing is the mouse click stop registering after 5 - 7 hours of idling. Relaunching this app, DeskDockServer, or replugging the device will solve the problem temporarily. Thank you very much for making this app.

Instructions inadequate and broken. Refers to nonexistent "3rd point" on Android developer page to setup Linux server. I emailed for help as instructed with detailed error messages, no response yet. Will update if response.

The app is really amazing! The functionality is all good! But I think that there are 2 things that can be improved: 1st is the layout off the app, is too old fashioned and even if it's just to control and see a few things, a more modern layout would bring a nice feeling while using it; The 2nd is the server app, it was easy to me to config and install it, but i'm a developer. I think that it's more difficult for a non-developer person.
Loove, perfect app, i don't need to say anything else.

This is a wonderful attempt for a "Synergy" like app for android. It is the first of its kind that still provides support and updates, while other developers have abandoned similar attempts. But despite the fact that I bought the paid version, there are some serious bugs that prevent me from having a smooth use of the app, and I really hope they get fixed at the next release. I use it with a Samsung 7.1 tablet. 1st of all, it is a bug that resets the PC mouse speed setting every 2-3 minutes. So when I move the pointer back to PC, the mouse speed gets reset and every time I have to set it back again. A workaround was to switch on the DeskDockServer Setting to "Only use shortcut to switch screen". But with this setting I have to use a keyboard  shortcut before I can move from PC to Android. 2nd. There are a couple of  other hiccups (that can also be treated with the solution i provided in my 1st point. 3rd, Relates to connection issues. e.g. You have to start the PC with the cable disconnected, start the PC application (or using the startup folder to start it automatically on every PC restart) and then connect the USB cable. I haven't tested it with WIFI yet.......NO MORE SPACE...
Worked for a few days then became unstable and would not stay connected.

Finally and app what distributed to linux too. I really like this app. There is some issue with moving the cursor from computer to the mobile  - sometimes doesn't move into the phone at first just jump the cursor to the middle of the computer screen and have to try to move the cursor again (if I move the cursor slowly at switching than it works fine)

very good. works instantly. does seem to conflict with usb tethering apps such as easy tether  only problem: on linux gnome desktop i cannot move the small java window to a lower desktop to get it off the screen without losing function, this only works on the desktop instance the window is open on

wasted almost a day in dealing with DESKTOP FREE, which is kind of unstable in borderless moving and connecting with the PC station. Finally a payment make the product way more reliable and stable for use. The most practicle part is the shared keyboard. Hope this Pro-version would not let me down. This comment is immediate because it corrected all potential problems. Appearantly it is worth the money. A WIN 10 + Samsung Tablet 10.5 user.
The app worked fine. The mouse is really glitchy though. It's hard for me to use. I would give 5 stars if the developer fixes that.
replyContent: The accuracy and fluidity of the mouse depends on the mouse model and driver you use.

content: Pretty tricky to set up depending on the device, however, once you manage to make it work it's perfect. I haven't found any other app that let's you send Alt and Ctrl keystrokes like this one, and the way you can switch between screens is really seamless. You can also make it work over simple WiFi if you know how to use adb a little. However, I wish it had a better presentation, perhaps to less knowledgeable people; also have maybe more updates? I really hope this app doesn't get abandoned...
replyContent: If you have specific ideas regarding the app's presentation, or for additional features, please send me an email.

content: This thing works excellently via USB with my Galaxy S9+ and my work computer. I can control both my phone and PC with one set of peripherals. Switching is seamless for the most part and the keyboard input response is near instantaneous. Mouse can be a little laggy at times but it's completely usable. No app breaking bugs that I'm aware of so far.

App is nice but I did not find any way to install on new device if the old one lost. Need to purchase again the pro version if anyone lost their device. So before purchasing this app think twice. One more thing is that there is no customer service for the pro users. Anyone can use the free app but before purchasing the pro app think again.
replyContent: As with any purchase from Google Play, you DO NOT have to pay again in order to redownload it or install it on a new / additional device. Just make sure you log in with the Google Play account you used for the purchase.

content: I have always loved using this app, but as of late, it is now causing my Windows 10 computer to completely freeze up. Even after I press control alt delete nothing happens Does anyone have any suggestions?

Work well when configured properly. 3 By default the cursor was hidden. After pressing the CTRL+SHIFT+H key if (Stated in State Tab). Also, even with the correct setting, I was not able to switch by moving my cursor to the edge of the screen. I had to press the configured Keys to switch to the Android screen.
It works, but there are times when I click on the phone screen, and it freezes the computer and eventually I get the blue screen on windows.
Does exactly what it says. Only major issue I have is that I have my cursor speed set higher then normal, and this app will frequently reset that speed down to default.
Amazing. Almost perfect. The mouse is hard to move very slowly, there's some kind of smoothing or something clamping it too much. Only complaint, still SO GOOD!

This is a five star idea but not very stable. I am running Windows 10 . While running DeskDock, sometimes I lose my mouse entirely and the PC locks up; a hard shutdown fixes it. Other times the mouse cursor shivers on the Android screen when given directional input, rendering it useless. Hopefully 1.1.8.2 fixed that. Now it is not crossing screens reliably; it hangs up on edge, refusing to go into the Android. That being said, this review was written using DeskDock Pro. When it works, I love it!

First I tought the PRO upgrade broke it. I lost my cursor and the software would barely connect. Connectin was solved by uninstalling Free, then reinstalling Pro, then rebooting. The software actually reminds you of that, but clicking OK from inside it didn't work automatically. Then I had another issue: The mouse cursor wouldn't show anymore. Several reboots of both software and device led to the question about "accept overlays" popping up again. I couldnt find it from the menus. Works now!!
replyContent: Yeah, Free and Pro interfere, so make sure only one of them is installed on the device at a time.

content: I have been using Across center for a month now but the connectivity was always laggy due to bluetooth connection. This is an Amazing app - I would give it 6 stars if I could. Only had some troubles with initial set up and connectivity (like app permissions etc,) but once that was done it was all smooth sailing. A note to the developer - It would be great if wi-fi connection for keyboard and mouse can be done - please look into adding this as a feature.
The copy'n paste is not working correctly.
Does what it says, no fuss, no miss.

After the update to Android 8.0 the cursor no longer showed on screen. With no support website or clues as to how I can fix this it rendered the app useless. My issue was that when taking me to the accessibility menu, there was no option to grant the permissions DeskDock needed. As a last resort I reinstalled DeskDock and then the option appeared in the accessibility menu allowing the app to work again. I have changed my rating from 2 to 4 stars... it would be 5 if more support was offered by the developer, even in the form of a message telling users to reinstall if they face issues such as mine.
replyContent: If you have troubles using the app, please send me an email, as listed within the app. Although I might not respond immediately, I do answer every reasonably polite email.

content: This is app is amazing when it works, but there are a few issues that make it frustrating to use at times. The enter gets sent on key up when other keys get sent on key down. The android loses keyboard/mouse focus when the screen rotation changes. The shortcut to switch from one device to another and back doesn't work when Visual Studio (and some other applications) have focus. This is probably an issue of Visual Studio taking all input and not letting it get to the program, but still frustrating and would love to see a fix if possible! The app stops letting me switch sometimes. This usually happens when I lock/unlock my PC, but can also randomly happen at other times (I have not noticed a pattern, yet). I have to force close and relaunch the app on both Android AND pc in order to get it working again. It happens at least once an hour and can be very frustrating.

I am a developer and this app allows me to use my tablet as if it was just 
an extra screen. It's like synergy, but better because it connects over usb 
with no hassle.

Great idea, but sometimes doesn't work flawlessly, either client or server 
app needs to be restarted. Wireless version would be awesome.

Great app! It has some issues with wifi and sleeping on my meizu pro 5, but 
on oukitel k10 works good.

Terrific app! Exactly what I was hoping for. In fact, I'm typing this 
review on my phone from me laptop! :)

This app is perfect. Allows me to use my mouse and keyboard with my desktop 
pc making my computing experience nearly seamless. It would be nice if 
there were options to place the phone screen inbetween two screens on my 
windows pc. And ever since Oreo came out my cursor doesn't draw over system 
ui elements which makes the notification bar difficult to use. But, this 
seems more like an android issue than deskdock. Update: The oreo issue is 
fixed now on googles end. And this dev is also super responsive to any 
issues you have with the app! One of the best Android purchases I have ever 
made.

Liking it as I am getting used to it. As per my previous review. I would 
like to see it to connect automatically once disconnected.

Been using this for years - since before version 1. Great productivity 
tool. I don't have to stop what I'm doing on my computer to deal with my 
phone. The transition is more or less seamless. Tons of respect for this 
developer - has stayed on top of updates and has no problem directly 
interfacing with users when issues arise.

I was looking everywhere for an app that would let me send keystrokes from 
a desktop PC to my phone. All the alternatives relied on a shaky wi-fi 
connection or wanted me to use telnet to make it happen. Imagine how 
gratifying it was to find an app that not only did just what I wanted (and 
only needed a simple USB cable to make it happen!) but all sorts of other 
useful things besides. The shared clipboard, keyboard shortcuts, and the 
multiple-monitor-style interface makes my phone feel like a natural 
extension of my PC. My whole PC-to-phone-and-back workflow is so much 
simpler now, and I'm getting things done on my phone much faster and more 
easily with KB&M. DeskDock is amazing.

Server application jar ver 1.1.1 is creating problems on ubuntu. As soon as application is invoked the Xorg probcess shoots up consuming 60% CPU. Please fix.   5 star rating for version below 1.1.1 Was searching an alternative for sharekm since long,  very happy to find this gem. Very handy. There are few glitches here and there but I'm sure this is in early stage and will improve with time. I consider my money well invested with this App :) keep up the good work!!

Works pretty well, closest I've come to a Synergy like experience.  I've hit a few small issues, where in landscape mode I only had access to the portrait mode area of the screen on a Pixel 2, and there is sometimes some delay moving from my PC to the Phone, and some oddities where occasionally backspace clears all the text.  However, the delay isn't always there, and in portrait mode there are no real issues.  Well worth a pick up if it's what you need.

Perfect! It works like a charm. The extended desktop feature was just 
genius!

I regret buying this app as it stands. Can't connect between MacbookPro and android tablet. I downloaded the most recent server app, enabled developer options on my tablet did everything right and still I can't get it to connect .
replyContent: If you have troubles with the app, please send me an email.

content:
Server is a bit unreliable and special keys some times does not works 
properly, apart from this the app works very well, it's certainly a great 
tool for developers

GAME CHANGING APP! Combine this app with a Mountie clip to mount your phone to your computer monitor and enjoy using your phone with your keyboard and mouse.  Add a bluetooth headset that pairs with both at the same time for audio and you're set.

Typing does not allow to use accents on words, for writing in Portuguese 
for example. Also, backspace deletes whole word instead of one char at a 
time. Paid 5.99€ for a app that only works partially. Edit: Raised to four 
stars because for some reason it now seems to be working. I reinstalled the 
app. Test: "á" "à" "não" "olá" Edit2: Back to 3 stars. It seems that after 
switching between pc and Android with the short cut triggers the 
malfunction. Switching between devices just by going through the edge of 
the screen creates no problems.
Very Buggy. Specially on Android 8.0.
replyContent: Should now work fine on Android 8.0. Please send me an email if it doesn't.

content:
I have a terrible time connecting to the server. Usually only works after a 
restart of my phone and computer. It's quite frustrating when it doesn't 
work. But when it does it is very handy and runs just fine. There are 
barely any latency issues and it's nice to be able to have more continuity 
between devices. If it was easier to get up and running it would be a 
standout app. After fiddling with it for a day, I've decided to drop this 
app all the way to one star. It's barely worth the hassle now.

The windows software could be better, it needs to be restarted every now 
and then. Otherwise perfect

Using this with my Arch Linux box. Only disappointing thing is I cannot 
seem to use any modifier keys when focused on my tablet. Makes ssh usage 
unintuitive. Otherwise it's great.

Very simple yet effective. On MIUI you have to activate two USB debugging 
in the developer settings. Sadly it does not work with "Second Space" 
though, too bad :(
How could I type vietnamese character via this app??  ex: á ự ê ...
replyContent: Please send me an email for further discussion.

content: Just found out about DeskDock this evening. Had been waiting for something like this for a long time.  I had some difficulty getting it working, but that was because adb wasn't finding my device (this is the hard part about getting DeskDock working, but it has nothing to do with DeskDock). First cause was a bad usb cable. Second cause was the unfortunate tendency for ModemManager (from NetworkManager) on Fedora recognizing the phone as a modem and trying to query it (it's done that with multiple phones now).  When I added 'ENV{ID_MM_DEVICE_IGNORE}="1"' to the line in /etc/udev/rules.d/51-android.rules, reload the udev rules (udevadm control --reload-rules && udevadm trigger), and reconnected my phone, everything worked.  I'm typing this up with my laptop keyboard. I'm very happy DeskDock.

Works well on USB. I can use my laptop mouse and keyboard on my phone. As a metter of fact I'm writting this review with this app. Thumbs up. Clipboard sharing feature is great. I was searching for this kind of funtionality for quite some time. Using a physical keyboard and mouse has much better experience when I'm working in my office.

Does not work with Gnome Linux. The DeskDockServer application uses a Java windowing interface that is no longer supported and therefore was removed from Gnome Linux. This causes the DeskDockServer to be unresponsive when attempting to connect to the Android application. However, does seem to work well on Windows.
Could be the perfect kb+mouse companion when it can work over wifi! But it is the best solution for kb+mouse share with windows 10.
Thank you very much, such an awesome software. But after installing the Pro version, the tray icon in Ubuntu 16.04 disappeared.
works over wifi as well with adb over network!
Connected, but keypresses are on computer and not phone...
replyContent: Send me an email.

content: Declared functionality works perfect on HTC10. Maybe it would be possible to display mobile screen on desktop screen (PiP)?
Little pissed I had to buy it to test it. The mouse lags more than it should, and critical shortcuts are broken. But it's ok in a pinch.
replyContent: You could have tried the Free version to test it. Mouse lag is usually caused by mouse drivers (if it is noticeable). What shortcuts are broken? Please send me an email.

content: I love it when it works. Have to restart the server sometimes when you connect / disconnect. Also, you have to install Java on your desktop. But over all, a productivity boost if you sit at your desk a lot.
Next to perfect, if only they added audio streaming. Works perfectly for sharing keyboard and mouse thou.
Amazing app which enables you to use your phone with the mouse and keyboard. As mentioned already, unfortuantely the changes in Android 8.0 prevents the app to work properly :(
Great app ! It will be even better if it can work over wifi without USB cable

Is perfect in every way.  BUT BEWARE: Android 8.0 Oreo makes it to where you cannot see the cursor above your notifications menu! Tell Google to change this feature so this app can work perfectly for everyone again. This is NOT the developer's fault, Google made the change to the code that allows this.
Great app, extends your desktop to your phone.
Newer versions work better for me, I have five devices hooked up right now, typing with my desktop computer on my tablet to write this.
Works great and very useful

I'm so glad to have this working! For the price, DeskDock soars above the competition. The functionality is well worth it. I typed this from my desktop keyboard connected to my tablet, and that feels great to say :)  proof it works!
this is amazin, it works so good it seems unreal.
Works amazingly well!
Despite days of attempts, I still have unstable connectivity. I feel cheated. Please refund!
replyContent: Send me an email and I'm happy to help.

content: A real gem of an App!! A virtual handsfree phone experience without taking up any additional screen real estate on the laptop.

5 Star to every single developer of this App! Very usefull. I can use it to multi-task using my phone. I STRONGLY RECOMMEND BUYING THE PAID APP. It will be worth every cent. Please develop more productivity apps like this! Cheers!
a bit confusing on how to set it all up of course, but im using my computer keyboard to type up this review and it works great! even with 2 tablets!
works very well on kubuntu 17.04 (use the -w switch on server to show the menu which doesn't show when clicked)
Not bad at all. Works with my windows 10 and I'm enjoying it.

Kind of hard to set up took me a while to figure it out. Make sure to follow all the steps. The first time I connected my phone the app simply didn't work: is said it was connected on both the phone and the pc but I couldn't get my mouse to go to my phone screen. However it worked after force-stopping the application in app manager.

The app works perfectly with my Galaxy S8 (and the developer was quick to fix a small issue that I had initially with the mouse pointer location). The client/server services work great, including a UI for positioning my phone exactly where I want it in my three-monitor desk setup. Love it!

It is amazing! I am sending a lot of SMS and email though my phone and it can be a pain sometime! But now with my computer and phone sync together it's so great! I rarely buy apps! But I am very proud to buy this one! Plan to keep for a long time!

I was a long time user of ShareKM. After the built in "time bomb" it had I used the time machine workaround through a xposed module but since xposed is not working on nougat yet I used the IOgear keysair. It works but I still liked ShareKM better. Today I remembered a program called Synergy that I used to use a long time and tried to get it working but it doesn't look like the Android app ever got past the alpha stage and will not stay connected to the server program. Then I remember this XDA thread. So glad I did. I first tested the free version and once I confirmed it worked I didn't have to think twice about the $5.49. I agree with others that it is a bit more expensive that some apps but I have wasted money on other things that I don't even use now. This I will use almost everyday while I am at my desk at work. Thank you!
Love it. As an android developer, I use this every single day, and would be lost without it. Thank you for the great app!

I had been looking for an app to extend my desktop (to actually change my tablet into a 2nd monitor). But none of those other apps worked. Deskdock, although it is for control of the tablet as a 2nd screen (rather than literally extending your PC desktop), is actually flawless. It doesn't hog PC resources and the mouse and keyboard have zero lag. Every other app out there was monstrously buggy for me, but this one works perfectly. Seriously, it's really, really good!
Very awesome app, works just as it should. Makes using apps in pop uf view actually useful because you can use a mouse to navigate and a keyboard that doesn't take up a third of the screen.
i love this app, but its input will take over google keyboards while switching languages in google, even i am not connected to pc, please fix this annoying issue, thanks
replyContent: Please send me an email with details on the issue!

content: Keyboard not working
replyContent: Please send me an email with details on the issue.

content: Best app ever! You will need to ensure that your Java is updated. The installer will take care of this for you on your client PC. Scroll all the way to the right of your screen and your mouse cursor will show up on your phone. You will then be able to type and use your mouse. I've tried several programs to achieve this and this is the only one which works flawlessly. Bought the app before download free version. Not sure if you need to uninstall the free version before installing pro. I hope all enjoy this app!
it works exactly as it should be
Quirky but very functional. Typed this review on my PC keyboard. Thanks for saving me the trouble of writing this app myself.

The only app I've found that actually does this reliably. Thanks for making an awesome application. There's a few bugs where every few days it seems to disconnect and I have to restart the applications but I understand it's still pretty new. If I could feature request it would be audio sharing. Even without that this is worth 5 stars. Kudos
Works like a charm!

Brilliant app, it works great and does everything it i supposed to. I found this app when my divice's screen cracked and the touch input stoped working, I was getting tired of plugging my mouse and keyboard between my laptop and my device... one issue though, when I'm runing Adroid Studio on my laptop and that window is in focus it seems to dissable draging the mouse into the Tablet screen, I first need to click on another window, or the desktop, then I can get the mouse into the tablet again.
Works perfectly on Linux! I FINALLY have a way to turn my Galaxy Note Pro into a second monitor for my Ubuntu 16.10 laptop. The developer was very quick to respond to my questions.
Awesome app !!!
Paid within minutes.  This works amazingly well with my Windows 10 computer and Nexus 6P.
It works as advertised :D

nice but needs work - why is backspace deleting the entire line? where is my alt+tab? bluetooth connection option please. like the two finger scroll. marginally better than across, not better than sharekm, heaps better than synergy
replyContent: Backspace should work as expected, alt+tab works on mac and linux (where the system doesn't occupy that shortcut). Please send me an email with details on issues and suggestions.

content: The only thing I dislike about the app is that you have to have DeskDock in focus on your PC for it to let you to control your tablet/phone. If I could just drag my mouse over to my tablet whenever I wanted to without having to open Settings for DeskDock on my PC and click on it to put it in focus, I would rate 5 stars. Other than that, it's pretty much perfect.
replyContent: Actually, you shouldn't have to focus the server program manually. Send me an email for further discussion.

content: Just a great app

Awesome, works super well!  The only reason I gave it 4 instead of 5 is because the screen border doesn't work (I'm also using Synergy for another computer, which may be a factor) and Ctrl+Shift+F10 is the worst hotkey for anything ever.
very usefull and great performance,.

I'll be honest about this app, it's f**king brilliant.  I'm running a 34 inch ultra wide screen and just wanted a very small decent res screen for looking up web pages etc and couldn't find one.  This resolve all my issues and allowed seamless movement between my PC and Tablet with my keyboard and mouse.  I'm glad I contributed my money to someone developing a worthwhile app

Amazing app, very fluid and exactly what I needed it for. Small issues here and there like scrolling will stop working, or mouse click events will randomly do something else, but a disconnect and reconnect will sort those out.   Even better that it can support multiple devices at once!
My phone now sits in a dock next to my screen while I'm working.

Exactly what I was looking for, pairs to my phone without mucking with servers and subnets.  Kind of a bummer the keyboard is a pro feature, as new stuff comes online you may want to make that one free.  All the same, I'm glad I bought it and use it every day.

Does what it says, it's still a very early version of the app i believe, so I'm expecting some more features that it must have in the future. Support is a 5star.  4 stars because it's quite expensive. and still bit hassle to use for newbs.

This app works perfectly with my Android tablet and my windows 10 system that has 4 external monitors attached.  Using the Settings in DeskDock Server on Windows 10, I can position the tablet screen exactly where  I want it in relation to the other monitors on my system.
Keeps updating an already amazing app

They have done all they could to make this the best secondaryish screen app for a laptop, I wish they can implement sound coming through laptop speakers but that would require a rooted device, other than that, this app is very very VERY good
Works great most of the time. Will sometimes need to be restarted because some keys will not function. Could not use backspace a few times. (ubuntu, Nexus 7)

I ran into some problem during the free version, but the developer was quick to reply to my email, and everything works out well. Really glad that I paid for the pro version, with the support for keyboard, it's just make life a whole lot easier. Worth every penny, really looking forward to more updates, and more keyboard shortcuts!

I find that I use this all the time.  There is a minor inconvenience involving initial connection (sometimes) but it is outweighed by the usefulness of the application.  If only I could hit "enter" to send texts though! Still, +1 star for you dev.

This app offers all the functionality I need to work on both my tablet and PC at the same time without requiring me to fiddle with multiple peripherals.  Problems with the app are quickly fixed by the developer, who is always eager to help. I had a problem with it a few versions back, after talking with the developer a new version was released only hours later and the app has been flawless ever since.

No longer works. I can see my mouse but it wont click on anything, also the keyboard doesn't work anymore but the clipboard does.  Edit: 1 star because of the rude developer. Requesting refund from google.
replyContent: I obviously need details in order to help you solve the issue. A server log, more specifically, would have been required.

content: Why is this not standard issue with android LOL. No more wasting tablet/phone screen area with a touch-screen keyboard at the office workstation.  I'm typing this review with DESK DOCK!!! :P
kind of fuzzi though.

I love this app.  It really has changed how I use my phone.  Being able to do things like copy and paste from my PC to my phone, share my keyboard, and easily control my device from my computer has never been easier.  Only thing I would say holding it back is a) it isn't just plug-and-play, you have to do some tinkering to get it up and running (enable debug, install correct drivers on your PC, etc.), b) no WiFi/Bluetooth option, and c) the desktop client doesn't self-update.  I still love it :-)
Not only does the app work exactly as expected, but the developer has fantastic response time to emails!  Could not recommend more!!
Works perfectly.  No lag.
Seems to work exactly as advertised, happy to pay for this. Thank you, dev.
Works pretty well.
replyContent: Please send me an email with details on your setup and when exactly the crashes happen.

content: What a wonderful app! This should have Android natively. I experienced problems at the beginig but make sure that your device is visible on ADB first. This review has been written from my PC using this app.
Best app of the year!!

Works great, mouse is a little laggy but I'm sure that'll get fine tuned a bit more. For a beta app it works very well! Keyboard support, like most I'm sure, is the main thing I wanted and that seems to work just fine.
Its a good app to use wiht the pc

It works! A little lag here and there. But you might notice it's still in some sort of "beta state". I have high hopes this app will age well. It's already worth its asking price, for the sake of using my PC keyboard on my tablet.
Now can use my surface 3 keyboard with my android phone on the plane. Will try to find the wifi hack, too.

Absolutely wonderful to have an app like this on the market again. I've wanted to write one ever since ShareKM stopped working, but never had the drive to do it. So happy someone else did! The app is working great and while the price is maybe a bit much (I'd have gone with $3.99 myself), it's absolutely worth the money.  Is there a specific reason for API level 16? I only ask because I have a level 15 device and I would love to be able to use it there as well if at all possible. I'd even take a one-off build with a broken feature via e-mail if it was possible!
Great app
Support was prompt and thorough.  Works great!
Amazing!
I will keep this simple..  It works and its very intuitive.  Can't see how they could have made it better than it is.  Bought the pro version,  worth every single penny..

This app is Amazing! I use it Always when I'm programming so I can test my apps without leaving mouse and keyboard. I've only a little problem... When I disconnect the phone from the computer the input method remains active and since I use more than one language on my phone I've to manually switch the keyboard. Hope you can fix it soon!
replyContent: That's strange! Please send me bug reports via email, not via Play Store reviews!

content: This app is something Android has been missing. I work in IT and and am always switching back and forth between a Windows machine and my phone. This allows me to consoladate the two and work more effectively. Great Job!

This app is perfect, exactly what I've been looking for. it even handles the high DPI of my mouse really well. as a bonus I can use macros programmed into my mouse with no issues (Android just sees them as keyboard input) I really cant say enough good things about this app.

This app does everything I've wanted an Android app to do for years since I used Synergy between Win/Linux.  I had an issue at first getting things to work and the developer was responding within mere seconds to help. Incredible!
replyContent:
Hi Chris,
Please send me an email and I'll give my best to help!

content: Does what it meant to do. Works seamlessly and great response from developer.
Works great even over WiFi via ADB over network.

I'm impressed that this app works exactly as advertized from the minute I configured everything correctly.  I can drive my Nexus just like any other screen on my laptop. Pointing, clicking, and scrolling all work great!  Now I need to build a holder for my device so that it can sit at the right angle beside my monitor.  Great work, Dev!  EDIT:  Oh, hang on.  Did I mention that you can connect multiple devices simultaneously?  Super handy.

To me, this is a game changer.  I've gone from using my Tylt QI charger every day to plugging my phone back in.  The only thing I would like to see is the ability to use my right control keys for shortcuts because I use a left hand mouse.

After reading the reviews, I knew that I was going to purchase the pro version right away. I often have to work on my tablet and computer at the same desk. This app makes things much easier. I found the app due to a highlight of it on Android Authority. I cannot wait to see what additions may come down the pike. Works great. Set-up required administrative priviledges on computer, so it may not work for all initially, but following the directions with the app worked perfectly. Galaxy Tab S2 & Windows 10 (64-bit) machine
Must have!

I finally got it working but the trip was absolute hell. So a warning for those who get this: If you are not technically proficient, this will be a chore. If you are technically proficient but don't root devices and unlock bootloaders, this will still be a chore. If you are already someone who roots devices, unlocks bootloaders etc, then you most likely have everything you need and will be up and running in minutes.
replyContent:
Update: Now that you have it working, would you mind updating your review to reflect the app itself, not the setup?
Please let me know if you find any issues!
You don't have to be familiar with ADB at all, you just have to find and install the correct ADB drivers for your device, which is really only an Internet research task.

content: The developer worked closely with me to fix an issue with the OS X Server. Now it works near flawlessly. I am writing this review with the keyboard, and I navigated to it with the mouse. I can go for a whole day at work without touching my phone!
DeskDock works exactly as advertised. Highly recommend the pro version!
I had a couple issues to start with, emailed the developer and got a response in less than an hour.  Everything working great.  Already sent it to 5 different friends.

Honestly I've been looking for one that works this well. First 5 minutes of using the free version made me quickly buy the PRO version for the keyboard support. Helps a lot in productivity since I don't need to waste precious time holding my phone while I'm at my computer.

Extremely useful! I have been looking for a way to control my smartphone with my PC mouse and keyboard for years. This app does that very elegantly. This app deserves every one of the 5 stars I'm giving it. If future versions of this app could provide additional functionality to call shortcuts (such as to Tasker) using PC keyboard shortcut keys, that would be excellent.

I'll admit, when I first installed it, all that it would do was show the mouse on the phone screen.  But after an email to the author, I found out a new server version fixed the issues I was having.  Sure enough, full functionality :)    Now I dont even need to pick up my phone when a text or message comes in.  Nicely done!!

This app is Amazing!!! Just what I have needed since Sharekm. I emailed the dev some questions and help I needed. Dev responded quickly and Helped me resolve my issue. This is a must have app!!! Great Job Dev!!
I am looking for such app a long time, and here it is

Downloaded the LITE version and tried it out with my MacBook Pro and I find I couldn't click anything on the phone (even though the mouse appeared). Purchased the PRO version in hopes it would work better, but I had the same results. Accessibility options were configured properly. #Nexus6P #AndroidN  EDIT/UPDATE: The author promptly released a new version of the server app for macOS and it's working great! Thanks for the support!
replyContent:
Hi,
This was an issue with server version 1.0.3 on some macs that I hopefully fixed with server 1.0.4. Please download server 1.0.4 and send me an email whether it works now!

content: This is perfect. I am typing this review from my PC keyboard while my phone sits happily on my desk beside my monitor. Mouse and keyboard work perfectly and the little hiccoughs in the mouse smoothness are minor.  KEY: I cannot get this to install on my Galaxy Tab S (as of writing) which has a custom ROM. Developer and I exchanged 23 e-mails, the first response being within ten minutes of my first e-mail to him. So props to him for great support. Looking forward to getting my Tablet to take this app as well
This app is so useful for development. Love how it works with multiple devices.
Works great!
Super useful app, has massive potential to greatly enhance the daily workflow for Android devs.

As someone who regularly uses thier laptop out and about, this enables me to use my tablet or phone (or both) as second screen. A lot less ALT+TAB, A lot more getting stuff done. Well worth the asking price.
Been looking for something like this for a long time. Price is a bit high, but paid it happily for something that works perfectly.

Seriously. This sounds spammy but it was worth the $6, typing this on my tablet via a bluetooth keyboard that is paired with my PC, and clicking around with USB mouse to PC. Even lets you set the pointer speed. Zero lag. It is perfect.
